TextBlock.TextLine: @ 3 Juny 1681 antwerpen
Duynekencken m. r: Herreford
In antw van ul aens van 22 pass sende inclusa de versoghte originale acte, met
d'infunnatie aen de wed. mattis gedaen, de welcke hope naer contentenm sal sijn
ul verseckerende van de genegentheyt die hebbe om ul hier eenigen dinst te comen den
Mons mr. Michel Caiot
cellecy ne serviia que pour vous advisez que aestes toilles de cottens tainte
et des aultres sont a present tous arrive tellement se vnd. grace at besoing
quelques un, il vous plaire demander, j'aij une soite qu'il est for bon &
fin, vous pouvez vous asseurez que je feray tous mon possible pour vous
rendre agreable service
In Antwarp 4 Juny
London Henry Maynard
Sr. my last to you was the 31: pass. sence recd. yd of 30 ditto tis well that you
will ship the goods for ostend, seeng 2 English ship ready to that purpose, so you
can divert our risico: I have given you creditt for my half pare in the bale of
Dozins aboard smith att Hull I hope they will prove to content, becauses the
pattarnes are not amiss & like m. Hills ordering much better then yett any
you had before, butt he allo wes to little for good measure for I finde by other
invoyces 3 yd a peece one with an other I do exspect invoyces of the rest of
the in ordered goods boath from the north & london, so that then there sails
be more then nothing wanting except the G.N. silver marck stuck cloathes
of which am glad you found out the right maker I hope itt be so, as
alsoo that I may have sidd amly 5 peecls of them when you meet aparcell
of worster frises buy some a begining that they might be here about the latter
and of July att furthest, to be assorted & ordered as last yeare as to the
ex eiuteurs of mad bouwens, they begon to sell their houshold goods this week
& will do the same with the ware howe goods this week & will do the same
with the ware house next week & then I supose they will take carets
pay all debts, intrim where as the goods ord mary sell verij low when sold
att the clandse, so they wish e you would discharge them of the 4 last
bales vrz 2 arrived & 2 aboard smith, as they supose, because you noted the
bayes aboard Richd pindar & they are not come with him, though they should
aather allow you some thing for intrest ther sale will do us no good which
yett I hope wee might regaine when that is cleared bij haveing a ware house
the less I have no more to add, butt that I want mony to remitt you as I could
wish to do, & that you may be confident that Ill take all possible chare
to promote yd content whilst I remaine with kinde saluts
4 Juny 1681
London Abram vivian
th
Sr. my last to you was on the 30h patt. sence rec. yd of 20 ditto
the patt send you must be observed in the 3 severall sorts desired viz
for a pack of duble dozins, for a pack of northrens of about 4
and for a pack of fine cloathes of about 5 s ayd raw you have recd.
mj remised for £375: in which you may not neglect to procure the need full
I have given you creditt for my ½ share in the bale with outN. I supose itt
is N.33: I hope the goods may come safe over, then Ill advise you how
I finde them, as yett you do not tell mee if any beshipt or nott, if
the cloathes should come to late to come with smith from Hull
latt 2 bales be shipt for Rotterdam thought you promise yd self so
much of there pattarnes, yett those of N.32 promise better though
the cullours of bouth have not a miss praydelire erustly m. patter
to contiaew his utmert endeavour that our concernesr
with hime might be of the more advantige for boath as & him the bay
where ready bought butt yett att leeds, so that I supose they shall not rectk
smith att Hull which if not must be shipt aboard the first that intende
for oft en de ouz an English vessel you are charged with bills, you can not asyett
exspect any suply from mee thought I endeavour to graspe al toghether
what yor can to promote our concernes & to drive ittso content of boath
Iebserve what you say as to the broad laces, which thought butt seldom to
be hadd, yett shall gett of the same waman of which I bought them out of the
packett N. 12: I have already bought for about 7 a ƒ800 of laces and can not
yett send one packett for want of the broadest sort, yd measure exceeding
to all what comes to markett, yett by this you recommend the breathes agane
so that I shall not exceed itt, butt endeavour to comply in all respects to yl order
& if possible send forward one packett next post in which I hope you shall finde
content, for I do now as much endeavour as Jean to incorridge you for the
future & remane
4 Juny 1681
London will Scawen
Sr. I have before mee yd of 20 past. as for our goods att bruges as yett the aggreation
is not come therefrom the court, so that the goods are detained except 10o peees
which mr. Coots gott out bj provision & sent mee I doubt & feare some obstaeles
might arrise, because they seldom tarry so long: I shall endeavour all I can
to sell att our best advantidge, butt the hollanders do bring itt so plentifull
here & sell itt from cleap to chap, that I feare wee shall not want much
more yett a while according to yd desire shall provide acurious pack of tykes
in returne of yd callicoes, & endeavour to make yd best advantidge: I have
examined the sale of 2 packetts of lace sent you & finde the errours underne
so the whole diffirence is 7 pence to my preiudice: I finde the sale to content
in consideration that you do not yett finde mee a master in that trade where
fore shall endeavour to dobetter & provide the sorts mentioned & contimee
god willing which is the needbull att present with hind saluto
Juny 1681
indon Lucy knightley
Sr. I have befor mee yd of 47: past.. I wonder whij you should finde reason to leave
mee when I give you my opinion of the goods that I receave from yd order what
I had from yd owne buying proved to content, as also what m. sijkes sent only
the lower sort of bayes were some what to deare, now if you please let mee
have onely now & then a bale fine of reds from yd selfs & I can contended to
desist for the rest, & allow you what you finde in reason must be, so when
you thinck convenient buy 2 auror as of £11:10: of a £12 st apr. 3 peeces
duble reds of £10:3 of 9 & 2 of 18 a peeces: to be 10 peeces in all in one bale
& send itt for ostend aboard an English vessel which hope you will performer: I h
ble thancke you for yd great hindress in recommending mee to innorth, I have
f
had alelter from him & have given an answer the 20 patt. which I know not
if become to yd handes, I should severy gladd in case I could beable to dohin
or you or any other of yd freinds any aggreable, service for be confident
that I am with all respects
as to the reds they must not be iust of the limitted price, f butt so as you finde
best penni worths & the bale to be vrapped with 2 bayes -
London dueley north
4 june 1681
Sr. I wrott to you what is here above the 21: past. which I feare might be nott
well delivered, becaused I did not write well yd name, the ardas silk is sold here
for about ƒ4:a pound of 16 ouneces of which 23 make a great pound english
itt payes no customes or any duties in wards, they sell here for arabate of
ƒ 12 pcc which is a custome up on sille aswere allow 8 pr up on
cloth so in case you finde any in corrigement you may be sure so fendemel
gent Jan B. tijsbart
In Antwerpen 4 June 1681
mons. in antwoort aenden ul van 2 deser hope dat eijndelijk de 32 stuken legaturen op Brag
sijn versonden aen Raphael coots om mijn ordre mede te volgen markende pack I N.4.
daer af dan het gepasseirde verwaghte te verstaen als mede derekeninghe vant
selve omvolgens te reguleeren & voorde weirde te sorgen terwijlen re
